Subject: Geography
Text: By the end of Year 7, students describe how the characteristics of places are perceived and valued differently by people.

Subject: Geography
Text: They describe the importance of environments to people.

Subject: Geography
Text: They describe the features of a distribution.

Subject: Geography
Text: They explain the interconnections between people and places and environments, and describe how these interconnections change places or environments.

Subject: Geography
Text: Students describe a response or strategy to address a geographical phenomenon or challenge.

Subject: Geography
Text: Students develop questions about a geographical phenomenon or challenge.

Subject: Geography
Text: They collect, organise and represent relevant data and information, using primary research methods and secondary research materials.

Subject: Geography
Text: They identify similarities and differences, and describe patterns in data and information.

Subject: Geography
Text: They draw conclusions about the impact of the geographical phenomenon or challenge on people, places and environments.

Subject: Geography
Text: They develop a strategy for action.

Subject: Geography
Text: Students use geographical knowledge, concepts, terms and relevant findings from sources to create descriptions, explanations and responses.

Subject: Geography
Text: By the end of Year 8, students explain how the interactions of people and environmental processes impact on the characteristics of places.

Subject: Geography
Text: They explain how the characteristics of places are perceived and valued differently by people.

Subject: Geography
Text: They describe the effects of human activity or hazards on environments.

Subject: Geography
Text: They explain the features of a distribution and identify implications.

Subject: Geography
Text: They explain the interconnections between people and places and environments.

Subject: Geography
Text: They explain how these interconnections change places or environments.

Subject: Geography
Text: Students explain responses or strategies to address a geographical phenomenon or challenge, referring to environmental, economic or social factors.

Subject: Geography
Text: Students develop relevant questions about a geographical phenomenon or challenge.

Subject: Geography
Text: They collect, organise and represent relevant and reliable data and information, using primary research methods and secondary research materials.

Subject: Geography
Text: They interpret and analyse data and information to explain patterns and trends and infer relationships.

Subject: Geography
Text: They draw reasoned conclusions about the impact of the geographical phenomenon or challenge.

Subject: Geography
Text: They decide on appropriate strategies for action and explain potential impacts.

Subject: Geography
Text: Students use geographical knowledge, methods, concepts, terms and reference findings from sources to create descriptions, explanations and responses.

Subject: Geography
Text: By the end of Year 9, students explain how peoples’ activities or environmental processes change the characteristics of places.

Subject: Geography
Text: They explain the effects of human activity on environments, and the effects of environments on human activity.

Subject: Geography
Text: They explain the features of biomes’ distribution and identify implications for environments.

Subject: Geography
Text: They analyse the interconnections between people and places and environments.

Subject: Geography
Text: They identify and explain how these interconnections influence people, and change places and environments.

Subject: Geography
Text: Students develop a range of questions about a geographical phenomenon or challenge.

Subject: Geography
Text: Students develop a range of questions about a geographical phenomenon or challenge.

Subject: Geography
Text: They collect, represent and compare relevant and reliable geographical data and information by using a range of primary research methods and secondary research materials in a range of formats.

Subject: Geography
Text: They interpret and analyse data and information to explain patterns and trends and infer relationships.

Subject: Geography
Text: They draw evidence-based conclusions about the impact of the geographical phenomenon or challenge.

Subject: Geography
Text: They develop and evaluate strategies, predict impacts and make a recommendation.

Subject: Geography
Text: Students use geographical knowledge, concepts, terms and digital tools as appropriate to develop descriptions, explanations and responses that acknowledge research findings.

Subject: Geography
Text: By the end of Year 10, students explain how the interactions of people and environmental processes at different scales change the characteristics of places.

Subject: Geography
Text: They explain the effects of human activity on environments, and the effect of environments on human activity, over time.

Subject: Geography
Text: They evaluate the implications of a distribution.

Subject: Geography
Text: They evaluate the extent of interconnections occurring between people and places and environments.

Subject: Geography
Text: They analyse changes that result from these interconnections and their consequences.

Subject: Geography
Text: Students evaluate strategies to address a geographical phenomenon or challenge, using environmental, social and economic criteria.

Subject: Geography
Text: Students develop a range of relevant questions about a geographical phenomenon or challenge.

Subject: Geography
Text: They collect, represent and compare relevant and reliable geographical data and information by using a range of primary research methods and secondary research materials, using appropriate formats.

Subject: Geography
Text: They interpret and analyse data and information to make generalisations and predictions, explain significant patterns and trends, and infer relationships.

Subject: Geography
Text: They draw evidence-based conclusions, based on relevant data and information, about the impact of the geographical phenomenon or challenge.

Subject: Geography
Text: They develop and evaluate strategies using criteria, recommend a strategy and explain the predicted impacts.

Subject: Geography
Text: Students use geographical knowledge, concepts, terms and digital tools as appropriate to develop descriptions, explanations and responses that synthesise research findings.
